result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthany James Hernandez

records.addlTxt: to the defendant from the Circuit Court Office regarding court appointed attorney

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Demand For Discovery, Notice of Intent To Use Statements of Defendant and DNA Evidence_2 - Hernandez, Anthany James.pdf

1:49 PM Defendant Anthany James Hernandez in court.  Attorney Matt Lantta in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has been looking for counsel, but hasn't found one yet. Defendant did not apply for SPD. Defendant referred to apply for a Court appointed Attorney. Attorney Lantta requests to proceed today with a preliminary hearing if the defendant does not wish to waive time limits for the preliminary hearing. The Court proceeds with the preliminary hearing. The State calls their first witness. Szvon Conway Sworn on oath & testifies under direct. Witness identifies the defendant. Defendant given his right to cross examine the witness. Defendant does not ask questions. Witness is excused from the stand. Court finds probable cause.  Defendant bound over for trial. Attorney Lantta does not have an information today and requests matter be set over for arraignment. Defendant updates phone number for the court. Bond continues. Matter set over.
Arraignment scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Demand For Discovery, Notice of Intent To Use Statements of Defendant and DNA Evidence

May not possess or consume any intoxicants. NO CONTACT WITH:  L.A.S. or C.A.S.. May not enter establishments (to include bars, taverns, or other premises) whose primary purpose is the sale of intoxicants with the exception of gas stations and grocery stores.  May enter gas stations and grocery stores but may not go into the area where intoxicants are sold.  Violation: Take/Drive Vehicle w/o Consent; Criminal Damage to Property-2cts.  Iss. Agency: Monticello Police Dept.

1:23 PM Defendant Anthany James Hernandez in court.  Attorney Matt Lantta in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court advises defendant of rights.  Court advises defendant of charges and penalties. Defendant referred to apply with State Public Defender. Defendant referred to apply with Judge's office for Court Appointed Attorney.  Bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 21, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
